Annotation.String: Common terms for all SAP vocabularies
A short, human-readable text suitable for labels and captions in UIs
A short, human-readable text suitable for tool tips in UIs
A descriptive text for values of the annotated property. Value MUST be a dynamic expression when used as metadata annotation.
The listed properties form a secondary key. Multiple secondary keys are possible using different qualifiers.
Control state of a property
Property must have a non-null value
Property may have a value or be null
Property value cannot be changed by end user
Property has no meaning in the current entity state and should be invisible for end users
Instance annotation for warning and info notifications
Only allowed within notification details

Property encodes a year number as string following the logical pattern (-?)YYYY(Y*) consisting of an optional minus sign for years B.C. followed by at least four digits. The string matches the regex pattern -?([1-9][0-9]{3,}|0[0-9]{3})
Property encodes a calendar quarter number as string following the logical pattern Q consisting of a single digit. The string matches the regex pattern [1-4]
Property encodes a calendar month number as string following the logical pattern MM consisting of two digits. The string matches the regex pattern 0[1-9]|1[0-2]
Property encodes a calendar week number as string following the logical pattern WW consisting of two digits. The string matches the regex pattern 0[1-9]|[1-4][0-9]|5[2-3]
Day number relative to a calendar month. Valid values are between 1 and 31.
Day number relative to a calendar year. Valid values are between 1 and 366.

Property encodes a calendar year and quarter as string following the logical pattern (-?)YYYY(Y*)Q consisting of an optional minus sign for years B.C. followed by at least five digits, where the last digit represents the quarter. The string matches the regex pattern -?([1-9][0-9]{3,}|0[0-9]{3})[1-4]

Property encodes a calendar year and month as string following the logical pattern (-?)YYYY(Y*)MM consisting of an optional minus sign for years B.C. followed by at least six digits, where the last two digits represent the months January to December. The string matches the regex pattern -?([1-9][0-9]{3,}|0[0-9]{3})(0[1-9]|1[0-2])

Property encodes a calendar year and week as string following the logical pattern (-?)YYYY(Y*)WW consisting of an optional minus sign for years B.C. followed by at least six digits, where the last two digits represent week number in the year. The string matches the regex pattern -?([1-9][0-9]{3,}|0[0-9]{3})(0[1-9]|[1-4][0-9]|5[2-3])

Property encodes a calendar date: year, month and day as string following the logical pattern (-?)YYYY(Y*)MMDD consisting of an optional minus sign for years B.C. followed by at least eight digits, where the last four digits represent the months January to December (MM) and the day of the month (DD). The string matches the regex pattern -?([1-9][0-9]{3,}|0[0-9]{3})(0[1-9]|1[0-2])(0[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01]) The regex pattern does not reflect the additional constraint for "Day-of-month Values": The day value must be no more than 30 if month is one of 04, 06, 09, or 11, no more than 28 if month is 02 and year is not divisible by 4, or is divisible by 100 but not by 400, and no more than 29 if month is 02 and year is divisible by 400, or by 4 but not by 100.
Property encodes a fiscal year number as string following the logical pattern YYYY(Y*) consisting of at least four digits. The string matches the regex pattern [1-9][0-9]{3,}
Property encodes a fiscal period as string following the logical pattern PPP consisting of three digits. The string matches the regex pattern [0-9]{3}

Property encodes a fiscal year and period as string following the logical pattern YYYY(Y*)PPP consisting of at least seven digits, where the last three digits represent the fiscal period in the year. The string matches the regex pattern ([1-9][0-9]{3,})([0-9]{3})
Property encodes a fiscal year variant
Only one term of the group identified with the Qualifier attribute can be applied
